Dispute_Type: Jurisdictional dispute over authority of prothonotaries
Legal_Issue: Whether prothonotaries have jurisdiction to hear and decide applications under Rule 419(1) of the Federal Court Rules
Governing_Law: Federal Court Act, Rule 419(1), Rule 336(1)(g), Section 46(1)(h)
Procedural_Stage: Interlocutory application stage; appeal from prothonotary's decision
Burden_of_Proof: On defendants to show lack of jurisdiction
Legal_Rule: Prothonotaries may hear and decide Rule 419(1) applications when properly assigned by the Chief Justice
Procedural_Issue: Assignment of judicial duties to prothonotaries under federal rules
Grounds_for_Claim: Plaintiffs alleged copyright infringement; defendants sought to strike statement of claim
Outcome_on_Merits: Case proceeds on merits after jurisdiction upheld
Decision_Maker: Federal Court (appellate division reviewing prothonotary's decision)
Key_Evidence_Considered: Statutory provisions: Federal Court Act and Federal Court Rules
Legal_Framework: Federal Court Rules and statutory delegation of authority
Applicant_Challenge: Defendants challenged the jurisdiction of the prothonotary
Court_Result: Jurisdiction upheld; application under Rule 419(1) validly decided by prothonotary
Legal_Rule_Source: Federal Court Act and Federal Court Rules
Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities for interlocutory matters, though jurisdiction is a question of law
Defendant_Response: Argued that only judges, not prothonotaries, can decide Rule 419(1) applications
Remedy_Requested: To strike the plaintiffs' statement of claim
Remedy_Sought: Striking of pleading based on alleged lack of jurisdiction
Legal_Provision: Rule 419(1), Rule 336(1)(g), Section 46(1)(h) of the Federal Court Rules and Act
Authority: Chief Justiceâ€™s assignment power to delegate to prothonotaries
Claimant_Status: Plaintiffs are copyright holders alleging infringement
Legal_Provision_Cited: Federal Court Act, Rule 419(1), Rule 336(1)(g), Section 46(1)(h)
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Allegation that prothonotary lacked jurisdiction to decide Rule 419(1) application
Applicable_Process: Interlocutory motion under Rule 419(1); appeal to Federal Court
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Application to strike statement of claim under Rule 419(1)
Jurisdiction: Federal Court; delegated authority to prothonotary
Governing_Rule: Rule 419(1) of the Federal Court Rules
